abstract: If there is a place that represents the intersection of democracy and capitalism in America, it is probably in Lower Manhattan at the corner of Wall and Broad. Protest movements have been drawn to Wall Street -- both the physical location and the abstract idea -- since the founding of the country.

headline.main: Wall Street's Long History of Protests
